post.description: Retrieve mulitple Property Definitions by a set of IDs. Searches within the specified tenant and the global scope.

parameters.description: The ids of the property definitions to retrieve
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The tenant to search
parameters.name: tenantId

post.description: Creates a new Property Definition. If the Property Definition to create conflicts with an existing definition, an error is raised.

parameters.description: The Property Definition to create or update
parameters.name: body

get.description: Retrieve Property Definitions that the current user may access. This API returns Property Definitions in the current tenant and global Property Definitions.

parameters.description: Page Number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of entries per page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Multiple comma-separated properties sorted in ascending or descending order
parameters.name: $orderby

parameters.description: Sets the number of returned entries from the top of the response (total number per page in relation to skip)
parameters.name: $top

parameters.description: Sets how many entries you would like to skip
parameters.name: $skip

parameters.description: Boolean expression for whether a particular entry should be included in the response
parameters.name: $filter

put.description: Creates or updates a Property Definition

parameters.description: The id of the Property Definition to create or update
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The Property Definition to create or update
parameters.name: body

put.summary: Create or update a Property Definition

404.description: Could not find specified Property Definition

delete.description: Deletes a Property Definition. If the tenantId is supplied, only a Property Definition that matches on id and tenant will be deleted. If tenantId is not supplied, this API will try to find a matching Property Definition in the current tenant. If no such Property Definition was found and the user has permission to manage global Property Definitions, find a matching global Property Definition.

parameters.description: The id of the Property Definition to delete
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The tenant in which to delete the Property Definition. Optional.
parameters.name: tenantId

get.description: Retrieve a single Property Definition by its id. Searches the current tenant. If no tenant specific definition is found, searches within the global scope.

parameters.description: The id of the Property Definition
parameters.name: id

post.description: Creates a new Property Group. If the Property Group to create conflicts with an existing Property Group, an error is raised

parameters.description: The Property Group to create
parameters.name: body

get.description: Retrieve Property Groups that the current user may access. This API returns Property Groups in the current tenant and global Property Groups.

parameters.description: Page Number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of entries per page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Multiple comma-separated properties sorted in ascending or descending order
parameters.name: $orderby

parameters.description: Sets the number of returned entries from the top of the response (total number per page in relation to skip)
parameters.name: $top

parameters.description: Sets how many entries you would like to skip
parameters.name: $skip

parameters.description: Boolean expression for whether a particular entry should be included in the response
parameters.name: $filter

put.description: Creates or updates a Property Group. If no Property Group with the specified id exists, it will be created. Else the existing Property Group will be updated

parameters.description: The id of the Property Group to create or update
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The Property Group to create or update
parameters.name: body

put.summary: Create or update a Property Group

404.description: Could not find specified Property Group

delete.description: Deletes a Property Group. If the tenantId is supplied, only a Property Group that matches on id and tenant will be deleted. If tenantId is not supplied, this API will try to find a matching Property Group in teh current tenant. If no such Property Group was found and the user has permission to manage global Property Groups, find a matching global Property Group

parameters.description: The id of the Property Group to delete
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The tenant in which to delete the PropertyGroup. Optional.

get.description: Retrieve a Property Group by its id. Searches the current tenant. If no tenant specific group is found, searches within the global scope.

parameters.description: the id of the Property Group
parameters.name: id

post.description: Retrieve the permissible values for a Property Definition with display advice of Dropdown. When the dropdown is backed by a vRO Script Action, the body must contain values for any parameters bound to other properties.

parameters.description: The id of the Property Definition
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The values of any bound properties
parameters.name: body

post.summary: Get permissible values for a Property Definition

post.description: Retrieve mulitple Property Groups by a set of ids. Searches within the specified tenant and in the global scope.

parameters.description: The ids of the Property Groups to retrieve
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The tenant to search
parameters.name: tenantId

classId.description: The identifier for this literal's class.

componentTypeId.description: The identifier for this literal's component type.

typeFilter.description: The type filter for this literal.

componentId.description: The identifier for this literal's component.

values.description: Map of values, keyed by the field ids of some complex type.

allOf.description: A complex value composed of multiple values keyed by the field ids of some complex type.

maxValue.description: The upper limit of the range.

minValue.description: The lower limit of the range.

allOf.description: Represents a range of money values, between some defined minimums and maximums.

amount.description: The amount associated with this value (with no specific currency).

allOf.description: Represents a single, precise monetary value.

basis.description: The span of time to calculate the rate of money for.

allOf.description: Represents a rate of money over time.

classId.description: The identifier of the type or category to which the referenced entity belongs.

id.description: The unique identifier of the referenced entity, encoded as a string

componentId.description: The durable identifier of a component registered in the suite component registry that owns and manages the referenced entity. This can be omitted if this component can be derived from the context within which this entity reference occurs. It must be specified, if no such context exists or if the component differs from that defined by the context.

allOf.description: Represents a reference to an entity defined somewhere in the suite.

items.description: The list of specified values. NOTE: All values must be of the same data type.

elementTypeId.description: The data type of the items in the list.

allOf.description: A literal which represents multiple values. All of these component values must be of the same data type.
A base type for literals representing a rate of some monetary value over a specified basis. E.g. $5 / hour; $1-2 / GB.
Wraps a secured string value, such as a password.
Wraps a Date & Time value. This is a wrapper for the Java {@link Date} class.

literal.description: Wraps a value such that values of different types can be treated generically.

allOf.description: Represents a reference to an entity by uri

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 code used to identify the currency (if any) associated with this value.

allOf.description: Base type for representing monetary values, encapsulating both some kind of quantity and a currency.
A literal defining period of time. This period is represented some integral number of a specified timeUnit.e.g. 6 days.

amount.description: The amount for the time span.

unit.description: The unit of measure for the time span. e.g: days.

timeSpan.description: A literal defining period of time. This period is represented some integral number of a specified timeUnit.e.g. 6 days.
